reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Aquabella over the 2009/ 2010 new year period. The hotel is located close to the centre of town, it would be at most a 10min walk from the main street. Parking is located nearby in a public car park, but as we found out if you have a nice car they will offer your free parking out the front. Unfortunately for us our car was not deemed to be nice enough!
reviews.title: Its a little bit meh
Loved the pool
reviews.text: The rooms were tired and need a facelift, in fact when we sat on one of the chairs in the arms fell off! The rooms were large, quiet and did have a good view over the town. Breakfast and dinner was over priced and pretty average. Unfortunately the staff seemed reluctant to help us find places in town to eat or reccomend sites to visit. The spa wasn't open while we were there so I can't comment on what it is like.

The pool area really makes this hotel, set in the old roman walls and whilst we were there is was 30oC, so that is where we spent most of our time. Rooms were comfortable and the food we had in the restaurant by the pool was good.
reviews.title: My Favorite Hotel in Aix-en-Provence

reviews.text: We didn't book any spa treatments in advance and there were very few treatments available on the day, so book before you arrive. Also don't leave any valuables in the carpark, we had our bikes with a number of locks on stolen from the roof of our car.
reviews.title: Corporate hotel, a bit overpriced, can be noisy

reviews.text: I used 1800Hotels to make my reservations for this visit. Stay away from this service. They promised a refund of a foreign exchange fee and after three correspondences have still not refunded it. I paid the flex fee and were no help when I needed to make changes in my reservations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in August 2009. The rooms are typical 3 * standard, clean, tidy and fresh which was all we needed and expected. The staff were always polite, friendly and helpful- which made us feel all the more welcome and relaxed. The pool was excellent- a great place to relax with very good pool side service. The hotel although looked quite worn from the outside, has a nice modern, reception, clean basic good sized rooms, a fantastic looking spa (although we never used it), a nice restaurant (though expensive) and lovely small gardens. It is just a 5 minute walk into the town, the shops, restaurants and bars - far enough not to be in the thick of any crowds but near enough for an easy stroll. The only small thing that we would have liked was a balcony- we had double doors opening out but no balcony- otherwise we would rate our stay as excellent- you could not ask better from a 3*hotel.
reviews.title: great 3* hotel, wonderfully relaxing holiday and very friendly people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a real gem! We stayed here for two days in July and could highly recommend it for anyone interested in seeing this beautiful city while having a really nice hotel, complete with pool and spa, only a ten minute stroll from the town centre. The staff could not be more helpful, and the food in "The Orangerie" worth checking out. I would also highly recommend having one of the wonderful salads in SplenDid in the town centre also ... quite amazing!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Aquabella and had a lovely time. The best feature of this hotel by far is the beautiful swimming pool enclosed by the original Roman wall and tower. With temperatures soaring to the mid 30s our days were spent lazing beside the pool and taking the occasional dip when we got too hot! It was absolute bliss! We were looking for a relaxing break with endless sunshine and cloudless blue skies and that's what we got!
reviews.title: Very relaxing stay at Aquabella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is ideally situated within the centre of Aix and is a 5-10 minute walk to both the old and new quarters. There are so many cafes/restaurants to choose from, all offering a wide selection of food. We found a stylish little brasserie style restaurant in the modern commercial part of Aix - Les Allees Provencales on Avenue Giuseppe Verdi called Le Darius (named after Darius Milhaud - the French Jazz composer whose family were from Aix). The food especially the desserts was delicious and the staff friendly and helpful as I struggled to recall my A Level French! We also ate at a few of the bustly more touristy cafes in the old quarter along Cours Mirabeau but found the food tastier and better value at Le Darius.
reviews.title: Great location and fab pool

reviews.text: If like me you love a bit of retail therapy then again head straight to Les Allees Provencales past La Rotonde and the dancing fountains where you'll find both high street stores and designer boutiques. For those of you with a sweet tooth I recommend La Cure Gourmande - an olde worlde style sweet/biscuit/chocolate shop. If modern Aix is not for you, then stick to the narrow Provencal streets of historic old Aix where you’ll find a plethora of fashion boutiques, cafes, pharmacies, ice cream vendors and corner style shops. Word of warning though Aix is NOT cheap so take plenty of cash!
reviews.title: Great hotel with excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
